entry.title: Re: creating workflow CR to block/unblock employee in SAP...
entry.content:
Hi, note 2570961 states

Business partners which are assigned to one of these role categories cannot be maintained using SAP Master Data Governance for business partners, customers or suppliers.

The usage of such workforce business partners in SAP Master Data Governance is also restricted:

  • In partner function maintenance: Only the ID of the workforce business partners is visible, and navigation to that business partner is not possible.
  • In business partner relationships: Relationships to workforce business partners are not visible and thus can’t be maintained.

So unless I'm very much mistaken, blocking Employees via MDG isn't possible.

Best regards, Ingo

entry.title: Re: CRforVS stuck forever on 13.0.26? (type initializer f...
entry.content:
Edit:
[The following was not correctly phrased]

On the development machine, there still *are* 13.0.26 versions in the GAC/MSIL; side by side with the 13.0.38 versions.
How would I unregister them (since that's the only idea I have left now for a possible source for the problem)

I made sure, though, that - using the "add reference/extensions" method only the 13.038 versions are listed in the references.
I even tried "browsing" to the location in MSIL alternately, but that also did not change anything.

correct:
when adding references using "add reference/extensions" method, 13.0.26 dlls have been listed along with 13.0.38.
They were *not* in GAC/MSIL, so - no unregistering needed.
I got rid of them being listed by:
- uninstalling CRforVS2022, reinstalling this time with option "install 32-bit runtime" checked, which I did not before

This seems to install Dlls to GAC/MSIL plus copy them to win64_x64
(full path: C:\Program Files (x86)\SAP BusinessObjects\Crystal Reports for .NET Framework 4.0\Common\SAP BusinessObjects Enterprise XI 4.0\win64_x64\dotnet)

While *none* are copied to Win32_x86
(full path: C:\Program Files (x86)\SAP BusinessObjects\Crystal Reports for .NET Framework 4.0\Common\SAP BusinessObjects Enterprise XI 4.0\win32_x86\dotnet)

I removed all references and re-established them by dragging a CRViewer-Control to an empty container. They point to the location in program files (x86) ... dotnet
When adding references by "add reference/extensions", the 13.0.26 versions are *not* listed anymore
Alas, it did not help with the problem.
Rebuild solution, run on target machine with runtime 13.0.38: error; run with runtime 13.0.26: runs fine

entry.title: Re: Approval Model Query Problem
entry.content:
Hello,
here is the query for the HANA Database:

SELECT CASE WHEN
CASE WHEN (SELECT "GrossBySal" FROM OADM T0) = 'Y' THEN
$[$38.123.Number] / $[$38.21.Number] * 100
ELSE $[$38.123.Number] / $[$38.10002049.Number] * 100 END < 27
THEN 'TRUE' ELSE 'FALSE' END
FROM DUMMY

----

hier is the query for the SQL Server:

SELECT CASE WHEN
CASE WHEN (SELECT "GrossBySal" FROM OADM T0) = 'Y' THEN
$[$38.123.Number] / $[$38.21.Number] * 100
ELSE $[$38.123.Number] / $[$38.10002049.Number] * 100 END < 27
THEN 'TRUE' ELSE 'FALSE' END

---

entry.title: Why no Delete options for Comments, Answers, Posts, Questions etc.
entry.content:
Hello Team,

My query is very evident from the subject.

Why we don't have 'Delete' options for Comments, Answers, Posts, Questions etc.

Mistakes do happen, and now in case I need to get something deleted I have to report my own content. 

Earlier there was a good simple Delete button available as an option.

Just a very simple example, in the below thread I wrongly added comment to the main post instead of posting the comment to another sub-comments thread. But there is no option to delete and now I have duplicate comments there.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/unable-to-update-manually-added-standard-fields-to-standard-odata-apis/qaa-p/13610919#M4818912

Thanks,

Sijin

entry.title: Re: "strange" dumps HTTP_SEND_ERROR happening once per mi...
entry.content: Hello ppinto, Have you resolved the error? If not, please check if the following SAP notes are helpful: 2935436 - Compression error while sending HTTP response 2888725 - ICM crashes after "invalid new-line in HTTP header" If none of the above SAP notes help, to further investigate, you may create a case (component BC-MID-ICF or BC-CST-IC) with SAP support by including the following information: 1. Log on to the backend system, go to SM50 -> Administration -> Trace -> Reset -> All Files. 2. Set trace level to 2 via the parameter rdisp/TRACE in RZ11. 3. Immediately reproduce the issue. 4. Once the issue is reproduced, please immediately set the trace level back to 1 via rdisp/TRACE in RZ11. 5. Compress the work folder (transaction AL11 -> DIR_HOME) to a .zip file and attach the .zip file to the case. Best regards, Charles

Björn

entry.title: Re: COPY Feature in SAP Fiori Element List Report App
entry.content:
I encountered a similar issue when trying to mimic "Copy as" function in SM31/SM30, then I've documented my approach here for future reference.

According to the SAPUI5 documentation, both List Report and Object Page support adding a default "Copy" button.

For a practical example, you can refer to the sample program Navigate to new Enity after copy action by gregorwolf.

 

In my approach, I implemented copy action to perform an INSERT into draft table. Specifically, I first inserted a record into the DraftAdministrativeData table, followed by an insertion into the target entity.

I’ve found that this method is only effective when the entity’s key fields are immutable at the time the draft is created—such as a UUID or an auto-incremented number. In other words, once the copy action has been performed, key fields like company code or customer code cannot be modified within Fiori Elements, since the copy action commits to the database immediately.

entry.title: Re: I want to color the SAC input controls according to t...
entry.content:
Hi @tsuuuu

Yes, you are correct, new analytic apps can no longer be created in SAC and therefore you only have access to the optimised story experience. This means that functionality was only feasible in Analytic Application with scripting+CSS.

Styling for entire input control is possible in stories but it applies globally to the whole control and not to individual items.

  • You can adjust these settings through the styling panel in the story designer. Select the input control widget àchange font, background colour, etc.
  • If story CSS editor is enabled in your tenant proceed to apply global CSS rules for the widget class.

For individual item styling, note that it is still not supported in the optimised story experience. Does not look like SAP has provided scripting hooks or per-option CSS classes.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Що дає курс “Applying Localization as a Self-Service for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition"
entry.content:
Наполегливо рекомендую курс “Applying Localization as a Self-Service for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition" не тільки технічним консультантам та партнерам, а й усім, хто хоче зрозуміти, які можливості локалізації та побудови стійких рішень є в SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Що для мене було найбільш корисним

  • Чіткі засади локалізації як самообслуговування та робота в керованих середовищах.
  • Налаштування онлайн‑перевірок і податкових кодів для відстроченого податку.
  • Adding Custom Fields (вбудована розширюваність).
  • Configure Custom Pricing (кероване налаштування умов ціноутворення без кастомного коду).
  • Створення структури для обов’язкової звітності через кастомні категорії, визначення фаз звітування, призначення організаційних одиниць і налаштування активностей для ефективної комплаєнс‑звітності
  • Інтеграція із SAP Document and Reporting Compliance для електронних документів і звітності.

Чому варто звернути увагу

  • Типові сценарії розширення локальної версії, що постачається SAP, для покриття специфічних галузевих або регіональних вимог як швидший шлях до відповідності локальним вимогам.

  • Побудова клієнтської локальної версії з використанням доступних інструментів самообслуговування там, де потрібне швидке рішення в межах корпоративних політик і контролів

  • Більше керованості та прозорості змін.
  • Менше кастомного коду й нижчий TCO завдяки керованим розширенням.

Реєструйтесь тут 🔗: https://lnkd.in/eiBgfZJa . 

Завдяки курсу Ви отримаєте не тільки знання, а й підтвердження вашої кваліфікації таким бейджем.

entry.title: Re: abapGit plug-in to import the ABAP Flight Reference S...
entry.content:
Hello @peter_munt4 

Your screenshots show an ADT/abapGit pull into a /DMO/* package in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (ABAP Cloud). The error Change recording must be activated for package /DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE

This happens because in Public Cloud, you cannot create or modify objects in SAP namespaces like /DMO/*or abapGit; therefore, you cannot create that package and can not enable recording on it.

What possible works in S/4HANA Public cloud

Do not use /DMO/*.
Create your own ABAP Cloud package (e.g., ZFLIGHT) via File ▸ New ▸ ABAP Package (Cloud). This creation process automatically sets Record Changes to On.

Pull with a customer prefix.
In abapGit repo settings:

    • Branch: abap-platform-cloud (you already have this).
    • Folder Logic: PREFIX.
    • Prefix: e.g. ZDMO_.
    • Package: your ZFLIGHT.
      This renames /DMO/* repo objects to ZDMO_* and stores them in your change-recordable package.

Open a Cloud transport.
In the Transport Organiser view, ensure you have an ABAP Cloud transport request (task) assigned to your user. If you do not see one, create a changeable package again (step 1) or ask the admin to grant the ABAP Cloud dev role and assign the software component.

Expect a few skips.
Some demo artifacts in the sample may not be released for S/4HANA Public Cloud; abapGit will mark those as not creatable and skip them.

Key constraint

If your goal is to use the SFLIGHT objects in an AMDP class: AMDP is not permitted in ABAP Cloud / S/4HANA Public Cloud. Use ABAP SQL/CDS and released the APIs  instead.

Let me know it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Unlocking the Potential of Artificial Intelligence in Enhancing User Experience in SAP Guided Buying
entry.content:
Hi there and welcome to my latest blog. 

My name is Angeline Gregory, I am one of the Solution Value Advisors based in the UK.  The world of procurement is continuously evolving, and with it are the tools and technologies aimed at optimizing organizational spend.  Here, I am excited to present my blog on how artificial intelligence can elevate the user experience in SAP Guided Buying.

SAP Guided Buying can steer users towards more efficient and compliant buying processes.  It is crucial to integrate advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) into your buying processes to enrich the experience.

The below features in SAP Guided Buying make purchasing decisions smoother and smarter and hence improve cost effectiveness and increases compliance.

Catalog Item Recommendation

The item recommendation feature suggests products and services based on users' past purchases.  It collects purchasing history from your organization and uses artificial intelligence to recommend catalog items that might be of interest based on the individual user. Item recommendations display in a carousel at the top of the home page, in the item details page or as alternatives to non-catalog item.

This feature improves productivity by:

  • Encouraging usage of catalog item when creating a non-catalog request​
  • Reducing effort when searching for items​
  • Reducing distractions when browsing
  • Improving user experience ​

Enable this feature by turning on the below parameters in SAP Guided Buying:

  • PARAM_ENABLE_ITEM_RECOMMENDATIONS
  • PARAM_ENABLE_CLICKSTREAM_PUBLISH

Note:

  • This feature is embedded AI-Feature included in your Guided Buying subscription 
  • At first SAP Guided Buying will show “Popular Items” based on organization’s most frequent purchases.  AI will learn and start showing “Recommended for you” items / services based on users clicks​.

Guided Buying Usage Report

The usage report in Guided Buying gives administrators insight into user searches, purchases, and overall interaction with SAP Guided Buying. SAP Guided Buying generates this report monthly to provides usage details, such as the number of users who signed in, number of users who added items to their cart, total number of items added to carts, and searches that returned no results.  This report helps answer business questions like which catalog areas to expand and the most popular search items.  By leveraging the insights from the Usage Report, organizations can continuously improve user experience based on data.

This feature improves efficiency by:

  • Highlighting opportunities based on user behavior, search patterns​ and search effectiveness analysis​
  • Aids making catalog improvements and helps bring spend under management​
  • Providing evidence- to make quicker design decisions

Enable this feature by turning on the below parameters in SAP Guided Buying:

  • PARAM_ENABLE_USAGE_REPORTS
  • PARAM_ENABLE_CLICKSTREAM_PUBLISH

Note:

  • ​This feature is embedded AI-Feature included in your Guided Buying subscription
  • SAP Guided Buying generates reports only after at least 100 unique users have cumulatively clicked “Add to cart” more than 1,000 times.  It must first collect and analyze a significant number of searching and purchasing actions 

​By using these features in guided buying systems, organizations can significantly help shape the way users buy goods or services.

Integrating AI and ML into guided buying isn't just about improving technology; it's about strategically enhancing the procurement process better suited to users' needs, while staying compliant and cost effective.

So, whether you are just starting out or looking to refine your procurement processes, consider how AI and ML can make a significant impact on your organization's guided buying system and watch as your bottom line and operational efficiencies improve.

Take the next steps by having a look at our comprehensive one-pager on AI and ML in SAP Guided Buying.

Thank you for reading my blog!!

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Check out the Cloud ERP Track!
entry.content:
SAP TechEd goes Hybrid

Join us in person at SAP TechEd Berlin on November 4-6, 2025 or online at SAP TechEd Virtual on November 4-6, 2025 to connect with SAP experts, broaden your technical expertise and to explore the latest innovations in application development.  

 

  What is in for me in the Cloud ERP Track? 

In the  track “Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP” you will explore how  Cloud ERP supports your digital transformation with solutions for your needs. Whether you’re adopting your first ERP or migrating from an existing one, learn how cloud ERP offers a comprehensive, modular, and extensible solution driven by built-in AI and analytics. 

This track covers a broad range of topics, including transitioning paths to SAP Business Suite with tools, services, and methodologies, extensibility both on-stack and side-by-side on SAP Business Technology Platform, clean core, architecture, AI, and many more.  

Our experts will not only talk about the latest innovations but will also showcase various demos and share best practices with you. You will also have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience.  

 

  Track stars (top sessions to keep on your radar) 

Start jour journey to Cloud ERP:

  • DT102 | Choosing the right path to SAP Business Suite for your business | or virtual DT102v 
  • DT161 | Implementation experience for SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT262 | Implementation accelerators for SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT103 | Guidance to ease your transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private | or virtual DT103v 
  • DT264 | How to start transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private 

Extend and continuously innovate with Cloud ERP: 

  • DT200 | Unravel the mysteries of clean core extensions in SAP Cloud ERP Private 
  • DT260 | Modernize classic extensions for clean core in SAP Cloud ERP Private 
  • DT201 | Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT261 | Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP 

 

 Get more insights!

Want to learn more about the track Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP? Explore the SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin and SAP TechEd 2025 Virtual session catalogs and ensure your favourite track sessions are on your list. 


Save the date and register today!     November 4-6, 2025      SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual

entry.title: Integration Suite OData PATCH
entry.content:
Hi,

I am struggling for quite some time to sole issues regarding OData services. Now my problem is with Sales Order Item. I want to change Reject Reason in item, but with OData adapter.

This is my connection:

processing:

Content Modifier before:

 

This is from log:
odata:PATCH_ENTRY?serviceUri=${exchangeProperty.endpoint}/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/
&resourcePath=RAW(A_SalesOrderItem(SalesOrder='0000000578',SalesOrderItem='000010'))
&alias=RAW(CUC_BO_SO_0109)
&authenticationType=Basic
&retrieveAllPages=true
&oDataMethod=PATCH_ENTRY
&contentType=application/atom+xml
&componentContentType=xml
&receiveTimeOut=60000&proxyType=default
&SystemQueryOption=RAW(sap-client=100&$format=json)
&retryOnFailure=false
&allowRequestHeaders=false
&setErrorResponseBody=true
&isKeyAutoGenerated=true
&allowResponseHeaders=false
&isCSRFEnabled=true
&serviceType=HCIOData&allowHttpSuccessPassThrough=true
&adapterVersion=1.26.0
&whitelistRequestHeaders=RAW(Accept:application/atom+xml|If-Match:*|content-type:application/atom+xml;type=entry)
&validateSystemQueryOption=true
&enableTLSSessionReuse=true
&enableMPLAttachments=false
&enableKeyManagerCache=true

 

And at the end error:

Error Details
com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Request Payload Parsing Failed for one of the reason: (1) Either the OData metadata content available in the server is outdated OR (2) The request payload seems to be incorrect. Error Details : Entity Set entry not found in the edmx.

Thank you

entry.title: Re: Problem with the CDS View "searchable" calculated column / case.. when column
entry.content:
The dump still happens in ABAP 7.58.

Impossible to use @search.defaultSearchElement: true on a column calculated by CASE ... END (whatever level this column appears in the cascaded CDS views).

Runtime error RAISE_SHORTDUMP, CX_SADL_DUMP_DATABASE_FAILURE:

  1. The program has indicated exception "CX_SADL_DUMP_DATABASE_FAILURE" as the reason for the termination: An unrecoverable error has occurred: See previous in exception chain. The exception is related to the previous exception "CX_SADL_GW_V2_FATAL_REQUEST" that occurred in program "SAPMHTTP", in line 0 of include "???".
  2. The reason for this exception was: Fatal error in SADL OData v2 request processing (mapping provider 'ZSD_OFFCOM') The exception is related to the previous exception "CX_SADL_SQL_EXECUTION" that occurred in program "CL_SADL_SQL_EXECUTOR_EXC_HNDLRCP", in line 2 of include "CL_SADL_SQL_EXECUTOR_EXC_HNDLRCM001".
  3. The reason for this exception was: Execution of a SADL-assembled SQL query failed, see previous exception The exception is related to the previous exception "CX_SY_OPEN_SQL_DB" that occurred in program "CL_SADL_SQL_EXECUTOR==========CP", in line 66 of include "CL_SADL_SQL_EXECUTOR==========CM00A".
  4. The reason for this exception was: The database has returned the SQL code 7. The error message is: feature not supported: CONTAINS predicates on expression CASE WHEN VBAK.SUBMI <> '1' THEN 'A' ELSE 'B' END.

SAP explanation (HANA limitation): 3232246 - feature not supported: CONTAINS predicates on expression "<expression>" - SAP for Me.

Problem also mentioned in this other question but still no solution): Search filed on a calculated field - SAP Community.

entry.title: Re: Group reporting: Unable to Consolidate correctly Equi...
entry.content:
Hello @TULLEYC 

Thanks, Colin, this is very helpful.

Brief response to your two points.

App name-
The app I meant is Manage Ownership Data (tile under Consolidation → Ownership). App IDs differ by tenant and release, so don’t worry if you don’t see F3440.

Manage Consolidation Group Structure - Unit View

How to exclude indirect ownership from the investment-elimination rule so 172100 is not affected twice

Do two things:

Maintain ownership as direct-only in the master data.

In Manage Ownership Data, maintain only the direct links:

  • J0184 → J0196: S0002 Direct Share = 30%
  • J0196 → J0197: S0002 Direct Share = 40%

Do not keep a J0184 → J0197 line at all (neither S0002 nor S0001)

Run Calculate Group Shares and Post Group Shares so the system derives the 12% indirectly for reporting, but there is no direct J0184↔J0197 relationship for rules to trigger.

Restrict the elimination rule for 172100 to direct share only.

In configuration, Define Rules for the Elimination of Investments

Find the rule that removes FS item 172100 (Investments in Subs/JV/Associates) with document type 3A.

Set Share for calculation to Direct Share (S0002).
This ensures the rule doesn't apply to group or indirect shares.

Make sure the rule requires a Partner Consolidation Unit, meaning it only works when there's a direct parent–child link.

For the Equity Method consolidation method, either:

Deactivate/remove any 172100-elimination row or keep it active only for subsidiary or proportionate methods, not for equity method methods.

Practical effect:
J0196↔J0197 (direct) still eliminates 172100 once.
J0184↔J0197 (indirect) won’t trigger because there's no direct link, and the rule only applies Direct Share.

Check your method assignment

For equity-accounted entities, use the provided Equity Method naming/numbers, which vary by content, but fall under the category Equity method.

Avoid using a Parent-Direct Shares method for equity-accounted investees; that method typically applies to full/prop subsidiaries and can unintentionally trigger 172100 elimination.

Carry out the sequence to verify.

Ownership: Calculate Group Shares → Post Group Shares

Consolidation Monitor: 02 Prepare Group Structure Changes: changes should not affect the equity-method units → 30 Consolidation of Investments

Check 172100 on J0197: you should see only one elimination in the direct J0196↔J0197, not two.

SAP Help-Manage Data Ownership

Please let me know how it goes.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How can I customize the standard 001 for the Person R...
entry.content:
Got it. So you are not trying to change the default that appears in CR01/CR02 for everyone, you want to keep the key “001” but have its description/meaning differ by plant location. In standard SAP, the “Person Responsible” field in the work center (technical field VERAN) is a key from a plant‑specific customizing table. That’s why you can maintain different texts for the same key in different plants.

Go to op10, select your plant, for that plant, maintain the key 001 with the description you want for that plant. Repeat for each plant location like Plant A → 001 = “John Smith” and Plant B → 001 = “Jane Doe”, etc. Save the transport.

For information, the “Person Responsible” list is plant‑dependent in this customizing. When you create or change a work center in CR01/CR02 for a given plant, the F4 help for Person Responsible will show the entries for that plant. You can therefore have the same key (001) mean different people in different plants without affecting other plants.

entry.title: Re: TDS provisioning
entry.content:
Hello @Rishav4 

Thank you for your follow-up and for sharing the screenshot. It is very helpful

Yes, your screenshot shows the right configuration path for rounding differences in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Configuration app: Automatic Account Determination Area: Financial Accounting → General Ledger Accounting → Resolve Differences for Open Items
Transaction Group: G/L (General Ledger) account clearing → Differences arising in G/L account clearing
Here, you maintain the rounding-difference G/L accounts (debit/credit) according to the Chart of Accounts. This is exactly where the posting key for cents is used to goes.

Why did the rounding difference appear

Even when the business amounts appear clean, a cent can be created due to the way SAP calculates and rounds:

Item-level rounding versus summary-level rounding

Conversion to the company code currency occurs per line item and is rounded to the currency’s decimal places.

When you clear multiple items, the system sums the locally rounded amounts; the total may vary by ±0.01 or ±1 for zero-decimal currencies.

Various decimal places

Examples: JPY (0 decimal places), KWD (3 decimal places) versus company code currency with 2 decimal places ⇒ rounding during conversion/clearing.

Foreign currency and rate timing

Original item posted at the rate on the document date; clearing at the clearing date or with a payment in transaction currency can cause a slight difference even if the transaction currency net is zero.

Cash discount and taxes in clearing

If a discount per payment terms/tolerances or tax recalculation occurs, the discount or tax line is calculated and rounded, leaving a cent on the balance line.

Tolerance settings enable automatic clearance with write-off

If the difference falls within your employee tolerance for clearing, SAP automatically posts it to the rounding G/L account you specified above.

Quick checks to pinpoint the exact cause

In Clear G/L Accounts (or in the created clearing document via Manage Journal Entries), open the processing/clearing log and compare document currency with company code currency per line.

Verify the currency of each open item, the exchange rate applied, and whether a discount was given.

Review tolerance groups for employees so you know whether the cent was auto written off, and confirm that both debit and credit rounding accounts are set for your Chart of Accounts YSDA in the node you showed.

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

You can find this preview on the current SAP Help Portal pages of SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

To access the preliminary What’s New information, please use What's New Viewer for SAP S/4HANA or What's New Viewer for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

For any feedback you may have, try the Commenting feature for What's New information in this release. To use this feature, you need to be logged into the SAP Help Portal. The feature is only available in the English version of the documents. To learn more about how the feedback process works in SAP Help Portal, see Giving Documentation Feedback.

entry.title: Re: Pricing - Condition activate with requirements
entry.content:
Hi @EdoTama ,

Let say you create a new item and the condition type Z001 has a requirement routine 902, here's what happens during pricing:

After entering Material and Quantity, you press Enter. The system calls Function Module PRICING.

    • Requirement Routine 902 is executed.
    • At this point, TKOMV[] is not yet filled, so the condition ZPRO is missing.
    • As a result, Requirement 902 fails, and Condition Z001 is not added to XKOMV[], and therefore not to TKOMV[] either.

By the end of the PRICING function, TKOMV[] is populated, and now includes the ZPRO condition.

So when you double-click the item, the system performs pricing again. This time, TKOMV[] is already filled from the first call. Hence, SUBRC = 0 (requirement check passes). However, condition Z001 is not redetermined at this point.

To force a new pricing determination, you need to manually click Update, or change a field that triggers pricing, or change a field and use the user exits to trigger your new pricing: USEREXIT_NEW_PRICING_VBAP / USEREXIT_NEW_PRICING_VBKD .

If you want automatic pricing redetermination without manual action, consider using: USEREXIT_CHECK_VBAP and PERFORM PREISFINDUNG(SAPFV45P) USING your_newpricing (could be B or C based on your setup).   

This forces a new pricing during item check.

Let me know if could help!
Thanks,
Dan

entry.title: Standard SAP input fields have a limitation of 255 characters, for QR code processing need more
entry.content:
Standard SAP input fields have a limitation of 255 characters. For QR code processing, we require an input field capable of handling up to 600 characters in RF- Screen. While a custom control was developed In Module Pool Program and functional in SAP GUI, it fails to render in ITS Mobile environments, displaying compatibility error messages., While Doing Configurations as While Creating HTML Template by following Details Internet Service : ZMOB Theme : 99HTML Template Name : ZWM_FG_LT1F Screen Number : 9002 Generating Style : Mobile Device ( No HTML Tables )


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

Login the RF transaction: 

  1. LM01. 
    1. Inbound process
    2. Putaway verification
      1. Scan Pallet code
      2. QR code verification field (item) is not enabled in the WebURL/in Device (ITS Zebra device).

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Public Cloud Alternative for FM DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET?
entry.content:
There's no direct replacement in ABAP Cloud, so it depends on what information you need from DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET.

You may access a partial list of the ABAP Dictionary attributes via RTTS (CL_ABAP_*DESCR classes), like the length, the type, structure components and so on, but you can't use the following four RTTS methods because they raise the runtime error CALL_METHOD_NOT_PERMITTED:

  • GET_DDIC_FIELD of CL_ABAP_ELEMDESCR
  • GET_DDIC_OBJECT and GET_DDIC_HEADER of CL_ABAP_TYPEDESCR
  • GET_DDIC_FIELD_LIST of CL_ABAP_STRUCTDESCR
  • There's a comment in the ABAP code of all these methods: "Calling get_ddic_field by a method with language version ABAP for SAP Cloud Platform results in the runtime error call_method_not_permitted."
  • All other RTTS methods are supported in It's the only method concerned in this class.
  • NB: the method GET_DDIC_FIELD_VALUES of CL_ABAP_ELEMDESCR is supported in ABAP Cloud.
  • NB: such error is mentioned in this question: Hi All,The class CL_ABAP_TYPEDESCR is released API... - SAP Community.
  • I didn't check the other RTTS classes (CL_ABAP_*_DESCR) but there's no other method named GET_DDIC_*.

There are also the following methods in the class XCO_CP_ABAP_DICTIONARY to get the specific ABAP Dictionary attributes: DATABASE_TABLE, STRUCTURE, DATA_ELEMENT, etc.

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – Which notification to use when – Workflow, Situation Handling, KPIs,
entry.content:
If anyone else would like to reproduce the issue in their system and report this to SAP, here's how you reproduce it:

  1. Identify a task for which work items are created in your system
  2. Use transaction SWF_PUSH_NOTIF_CUST to define a customized "Text to display when notifications are grouped together"
 
Expected result:
Notifications > By Type uses the customized text
Fiori settings > Notifications uses the customized text
 
Actual result:
Notifications > By Type uses the customized text
Fiori settings > Notifications does not
 
 
In more general terms the above expected and actual results can be described as:
 
Expected result:
The text in Fiori settings > Notifications is the same as the heading in Fiori notifications > By Type so the user knows which entry to disable in the settings to stop receiving a certain type of notifications.
 
Actual result:
The text in Fiori settings > Notifications is not the same as the heading in Fiori notifications > By Type and the user can't tell which entry to disable in the settings to stop receiving a certain type of notifications.

entry.title: Competencies & PG Forms
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have a client who currently has competencies configured and mapped, and an ongoing Performance campaign.

They now want to change all the competencies in order to launch the 2026 performance campaign with a new competency structure.

My understanding is that if I remove all the existing competencies from the Centre of Capabilities or the Job Profile Builder, the already launched performance forms will remain unaffected and will still display the old competencies.

So the expected result would be:

  • 2025 performance forms: still show the old competencies (even though they have been removed or replaced in the Centre of Capabilities)
  • 2026 performance forms: show the new competencies

    Does everyone agree with this approach?

    Also, if you see any risks or other potential impacts in carrying out this operation, please let me know.

    Thank you in advance for your help 😊

    Kind regards,
    Serena

entry.title: Re: S4HC Public Cloud Eclipse created CDS and AMDP
entry.content:
Hello @peter_munt4 

Many thanks for the follow-up. In on-premise S/4HANA, you control the ABAP OAuth server and can enable OAuth 2.0 for any OData service.

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, inbound OAuth is only available for communication scenarios that SAP has enabled. SAP_COM_0303 does not offer OAuth; it only supports Basic or Client Certificate. Your options in Public Cloud include using Client Certificate/Basic directly or placing SAP API Management in front to expose OAuth and then forwarding to S/4 with cert/basic authentication behind it.

Your 3-tier landscape does not change these auth limits.

Let me know if you have further information.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Business Partner Replication from S/4HANA Public Cloud to EWM fails due to missing General Role
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are currently facing an issue with Business Partner replication via DRF from S/4HANA Public Cloud to a decentral SAP EWM system.

Scenario

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, when we create a Business Partner (with Customer and/or Vendor roles), the General role (000000) is not visible/maintained in the frontend.

  • When replicating this BP via DRF , the message is successfully sent from S/4HANA Cloud.

  • However, in EWM inbound processing , the message fails with an Application Error.

Error Log in EWM

In transaction SRT_MONI, we see the following details:

 

Analysis

  • EWM requires the General BP role (000000) to be present in order to assign and process additional roles (Customer, Vendor, etc.).

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, this General role seems to be handled internally, but it is not explicitly replicated via DRF.

  • As a result, the EWM inbound proxy cannot process the payload and throws the application error.

Questions

  1. Is there an official fix or SAP Note that covers this gap (e.g., automatic inclusion of General role during DRF replication)?

  2. If not, do we need to build a custom solution (BAdI / extension in S/4HANA Public Cloud or EWM) to enrich the payload with BP role 000000 before EWM processes it? If yes, is this only possible on the EWM side?

  3. Can confirm whether this scenario is supported out-of-the-box, or if it is out of scope for standard S/4HANA Cloud ↔ EWM integration?

Additional Context

  • The issue is reproducible with any new BP replication.

  • In S/4HANA Cloud, the DRF message monitor shows successful processing, but the EWM side always fails with the error mentioned.

  • We already verified that the inbound service BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In is active and the communication arrangement is correct.

Any insights, SAP Notes, or confirmation from SAP would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,

To sum up, we checked all the items you mentioned, therefore we're wondering why it isn't working and why the LOIWCS idoc is still send to plant 1000 instead of 1000D

entry.title: Re: SAP DM - Plant Mapping/Conversion: Integration of dif...
entry.content: In our case the destination name in CI and logical system in ERP have the same name, therefore we have just 3 entries (the other 3 would be duplicates). We also enabled ENABLE_PLANT_CONVERSION and deployed both, value mapping + ENABLE_PLANT_CONVERSION

entry.title: Re: SAP DM - Plant Mapping/Conversion: Integration of dif...
entry.content: in the default values tab nothing is set, it's not editable

entry.title: Re: ONB2 - Custom Task JSON Rule for field visibility bas...
entry.content: Hi Gopi, Thanks but that blog talks about setting field visibility based on a single value. I've got that working. What I'm after is, based on multiple values - which uses something like ANYOF.

entry.title: Re: SAC Performance Issues - Number of Dimension Attributes
entry.content:
In BW, you can set the “Display Attributes” to “Not Displayed” or only keep the ones you need.

This reduces metadata load for SAC dramatically.

entry.title: Re: SAP DM - Plant Mapping/Conversion: Integration of dif...
entry.content: We have entries there. Have you open the flow via Configure and selected the first ERP line?

entry.title: Re: Payment term block issue
entry.content:
I don't know a validity date in T052, there is a 'obsolete' flag to prevent display in input search-help (oss notes can be required if not up-to-date, such as 3272937 - Obsolete payment terms are displayed in payment terms Searchhelp in Manage Purchase orders app. or 2401700 - FI: Hiding obsolete entries in input helps for terms of payment)

If you want to prevent their use, consider Validation rules (FI) or BAdI (MM) but first, establish precise management rules (for example, in the event of a document cancellation or modification).

entry.title: Re: Payment term block issue
entry.content: In ,which version do you have a valid-to date for payment terms?

entry.title: Re: Step-by-Step Guide to Translating Adobe Forms into Other Languages in SAP
entry.content: Thank you for your contribution. In the newly created form outputs, the translation process for the desired language can be performed more simply using the ‘RS_TEXTPOOL_READ’ function via the FM called with the dynamic text field usage. This way, we can prevent fixed text processing.

entry.content: Dear Jigar please did you solve this issue ?

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud: Professional Service Project Amount total update
entry.content:
We wanted to update the amount total of the Project we created under professional service by creating a credit memo and reducing its amount.

When I try to create a credit memo and post it to Accounting, I notice that it does not update the project even though I create it with reference to an existing posted invoice.

 

I notice that the WBS Element created is being substituted and although part of the Project, it is not part of the work package created inside my project. I think this is the reason why it is not updating the Customer Project amount.

 

When I check the log during billing document creation, this is the message I saw: Revenue of leading WBS element CXXXX determined by substitution from CXXXX.

 

Can you be able to help where to check this? 

 

Thank you.

entry.title: S4 Public Cloud - Embedded Steampunk - Custom Adobe Form from scratch
entry.content:
Hello, 

I'm working on an S4 Public Cloud project using an Embedded Steampunk (RAP) environment. I need to build an app from scratch with a button to print a PDF form.

Therefore, I cannot use any predefined form templates. I must create a custom template and a custom data source, all from scratch, and then be able to use it from my RAP app.

I've reviewed note 3356705 (https://me.sap.com/notes/3356705/E), which states that it's not possible to upload templates with the Maintain Form Templates app because a custom data source cannot be used. Therefore, I would assume it's not possible.

But I also reviewed note 3355397 (https://me.sap.com/notes/3355397/E). This note states that, starting with version 2508, the CL_FP_FORM_READER class exists to work with forms using ADTs (RAP).

The problem is that if I can't upload forms from scratch and data sources from scratch, am I still unable to create and work with custom forms from my custom apps?

The notes are a bit confusing. Does anyone know if this is now possible without using the Adobe Forms BTP service? That is, by creating the custom forms directly in the S4 Public Cloud.

Thanks a lot. 

Kind Regards.
